td.content: s:28 YO white m indicates moderate weakness, mild vague postprandial epigastric pain, moderate vomiting and Cancer. patient has a 1 pack per day habit describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 3 years in his past o:Height 66 in, Weight 173 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed 5-FU - 1000 mg/m2 IV, cisplatin - 100 mg/m2 IV, and ordered EGD.

s:a white male ophthalmologist aged 28 years presents with mild vague postprandial epigastric pain, moderate weakness. he has history of moderate vomiting. he smokes one pack/day of cigarettes drinks daily o:Height 66 in, Weight 172 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, EGD shows esophagitis with a massive gastric ulcer extending from the inscura to the pylorus, no active bleeding was noted at the site a:Stomach Cancer p:performed EGD, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
